description: From Latin assūmō (“accept, take”), from ad- (“to, towards, at”) + sūmō (“take up, assume”).

verbs.description: assume (third-person singular simple present assumes, present participle assuming, simple past and past participle assumed)

entries.meaning: To authenticate by means of belief; to surmise; to suppose to be true, especially without proof
examples: We assume that, as her parents were dentists, she knows quite a bit about dentistry.

entries.meaning: To take on a position, duty or form
examples: Mr. Jones will assume the position of a lifeguard until a proper replacement is found.

entries.meaning: To adopt a feigned quality or manner; to claim without right; to arrogate
examples: He assumed an air of indifference
